title: Bayesian Hypothesis Testing
contentHtml:
Bayesian hypothesis testing is a powerful tool for comparing models in Bayesian statistics.

We'll explore how to use Bayes factors and posterior odds to determine the likelihood of one model being better than another.
problemHtml: Suppose we want to compare two models for predicting stock prices: a simple linear model and a more complex neural network.

finalAnswer: The model with the higher Bayes factor is more likely to be correct" },
intuition: Bayesian hypothesis testing helps us make informed decisions by quantifying the relative support for each model.
realWorldApplications: Comparing models in natural language processing

subject: statistics
title: Bayesian Hypothesis Testing: Bayes Factors
contentHtml: Bayesian hypothesis testing is a powerful approach to model comparison and selection in machine learning. The key concept is the Bayes factor, which measures the relative probability of two competing models.
name: Bayes Factor" },
problemHtml: Suppose we want to compare a linear regression model with a polynomial regression model for predicting house prices. We have a dataset of 100 observations.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Specify the two models and their prior probabilities", "mathHtml": "\(P(M_0) = 0.5\), \(P(M_1) = 0.5\)"}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Compute the likelihood of the data under each model", "mathHtml": "\(P(D|M_0)\), \(P(D|M_1)\)"}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Calculate the Bayes factor using the posterior probabilities", "mathHtml": "\[BF = \frac{P(M_1|D)}{P(M_0|D)}\]"} ],
intuition: The Bayes factor provides a way to quantify the relative evidence for one model over another, allowing us to make informed decisions about which model is more likely to be correct.
